of the small business customers

health insurance rate increase

257.80.text:
that is an unreasonable

and Health Insurance Company,

263.90.text:
made a 25.2% return

273.49.text:
and one which is unreasonable.
Third.

The third reason we've concluded

280.50.text:
rate increase is unreasonable,

284.22.text:
an Affordable Care Act Fee
from its small business customers

291.90.text:
does not have to pay to

301.00.text:
from small business customers
--  who are struggling

to keep their doors open

306.04.text:

308.94.text:

313.20.text:
that Anthem has to pay that fee

is to implement the

325.69.text:
is that the small business

In either of those cases

in 2013,

383.71.text:
imposed on its small business

415.60.text:
that they're being forced

This is extraordinarily frustrating. 
It's frustrating

for me

442.50.text:
does not give the Insurance

449.70.text:

452.30.text:
in the Affordable Care Act

455.06.text:

we will make a recommendation

1381.60.text:
But, this particular company, 
and its sister company;

1386.61.text:
this particular company,
is the only company

1389.50.text:
for which we've had three 
consecutive findings

1393.15.text:
that the rate increase 
is unreasonable.

1395.90.text:
That is I think 
an extraordinary,

1401.30.text:
an extraordinarily disappointing
set of findings.

1405.67.text:
I know I'm very disappointed, 
and I know

1408.20.text:
that California small businesses 
are disappointed as well,

1414.22.text:
in this regard are not binding 
on health insurers or HMOs.

1417.20.text:
It's a big missing piece, 
a big loophole in our

1421.43.text:
state and federal laws, 
and one that needs to be fixed.

1424.50.text:
But that's the state of the law 
right now.

1426.20.text:
So, what we do is we review.
We share our findings.

1430.44.text:
We do everything we can 
to urge the carrier

1433.44.text:
to refrain 
from an excessive rate.

1435.46.text:
But unfortunately, ultimately
they make the call;

1440.28.text:
and that's exactly what
has happened here;

1443.02.text:
and is happening increasingly 
across the market.

1450.02.text:
[Operator] Once again, 
if you have any questions,

1453.49.text:
Please press star one "*" "1" 
on your touch-tone phone.

1464.10.text:
At this time I am showing 
no questions.

1466.80.text:
[Dave Jones] Great! 
Operator, thank you very much.

1468.84.text:
and I want to thank all those 
who participated on the call.

1473.74.text:
If folks do have questions
later on,

1477.89.text:
what we want to do is encourage 
them to contact our media office

1489.85.text:
and we can certainly 
make ourselves available

1492.89.text:
to get you the answers you need.
And we appreciate your covering

1498.00.text:
Oh, I'm sorry we have one more 
question in the room,

1500.86.text:
let's go to that 
before we sign off

1505.39.text:
We have another question 
in the room. Yes.

1508.30.text:
(Inaudible question asked by 
an unidentified woman reporter)

1523.30.text:
[Dave Jones]  Certainly. 
So, the question is:

1525.90.text:
What is the core announcement 
that we're making today?

1531.00.text:
That Anthem Blue Cross Life 
and Health Insurance Company

1536.60.text:
is imposing 
an unreasonable rate increase

1539.50.text:
on its small business customers
effective July 1.

1544.44.text:
This is the third unreasonable rate
increased by Anthem Blue Cross.

1548.21.text:
And as a result, 
I'm recommending

1550.60.text:
that both Anthem Blue Cross 
and its sister company

1552.90.text:
Blue Cross of California, 
be excluded

1555.85.text:
from being able to sell
health insurance and HMO product

1559.85.text:
in the California 
Health Benefits Exchange.

1562.89.text:
And so, we're doing everything 
we can, to make sure

1566.30.text:
that there are consequences
for these unreasonable 
rate increases.

1569.20.text:
Unfortunately, the law
ties my hands behind my back

1572.65.text:
with regard to this,
because my determinations

1577.20.text:
are not binding. 
The most I can do -

1580.13.text:
and that's exactly  
what we're doing today -

1582.27.text:
is when we see a pattern or practice 
of unreasonable rate increases,

1587.36.text:
that those companies 
not be allowed

1589.32.text:
to sell in the 
Health Benefits Exchange.

1591.90.text:
And, that's exactly what 
we're doing today.

1596.21.text:
All right operator, 
one last call to see

1598.74.text:
if there are any other
questions on the line,

1601.20.text:
if not we will
close to the press conference.

1604.84.text:
[Operator] Once again, 
if there are any questions

1606.40.text:
please press star "*" then "1" 
on your touch-tone phone.

1615.34.text:
I'm showing no questions 
at this time.

1616.80.text:
[Dave Jones] Thank you. 
Thanks everyone here in the room.

1618.50.text:
and thanks 
to all those who participate

1619.96.text:
on the call.
